snippet: A leak on Monday forced the evacuation of a remote Utah elementary school and sent more than 40 students and staff members to medical facilities in Utah and Colorado.
abstract: Carbon monoxide leak forces evacuation of remote elementary school in Montezuma Creek, Utah, sending more than 40 students and staff members to medical facilities for treatment; leak appears to have been caused by a water heater with a blocked ventilation system.
lead_paragraph: A leak on Monday forced the evacuation of a remote Utah elementary school and sent more than 40 students and staff members to medical facilities in Utah and Colorado.

headline.main: Carbon Monoxide in Utah School Sends Dozens to Hospitals
headline.print_headline: Carbon Monoxide in Utah School Sends Dozens to Hospitals
